qas.question: What decade saw international initiatives to combat corruption?
Who started the Programme of Action?

answers.text: Ministers of the Council of Europe

qas.question: What did the Programme of Action issue?

answers.text: a series of anti-corruption standard-setting instruments

context: In the <a0_0>1990s<a0_0/>, initiatives were taken at an international level (in particular by the European Community, the Council of Europe, the OECD) to put a ban on corruption: in 1996, the Committee of <a1_0>Ministers of the Council of Europe<a1_0/>, for instance, adopted a comprehensive Programme of Action against Corruption and, subsequently, issued <a2_0>a series of anti-corruption standard-setting instruments<a2_0/>:
